title: Retro Home Deliveries
description: Milkmen, ice deliveries, and door-to-door culture

questions.question: What type of container did the milkman typically leave on your doorstep, which you would return empty?
Before electric refrigerators became common, what did the iceman deliver to homes to keep food cold?
What small metal or wooden box was placed outside many homes to receive milk deliveries?
options: A milk chute or milk box

questions.question: Which famous encyclopedia set was commonly sold door-to-door by traveling salesmen in the mid-20th century?
What household product did the Fuller Brush Man famously sell door-to-door starting in 1906?
In the days of ice delivery, what sign did families place in their window to tell the iceman how many pounds they needed?
options: A cardboard sign with numbers on each side

questions.question: Which cosmetics company became famous for its door-to-door sales representatives, mostly women, starting in 1886?
What did children commonly do when the ice delivery truck stopped in their neighborhood on a hot summer day?
options: Grab ice chips that fell off the truck

questions.question: The Charles Chips delivery service brought what snack food to homes in distinctive tins?
Which mail-order music club famously offered '12 records or tapes for just one penny' through ads in magazines?
What essential household fuel was commonly delivered by truck to homes before natural gas pipelines became widespread?
Which company's door-to-door vacuum cleaner demonstrations became legendary, with salesmen dumping dirt on carpets?
What day of the week did many families traditionally expect their milkman to make his delivery rounds?
The Jewel Tea Company sent 'route men' to homes selling what kind of products, often with premium rewards?
What large kitchen appliance, called an 'icebox,' was used before electric refrigerators and required regular ice deliveries?
options: An insulated wooden cabinet that held a block of ice
